title: NASA prepares to award SLS launch services contract to Boeing-Northrop joint venture
summary: NASA is preparing to award a contract to a Boeing-Northrop Grumman joint venture for Space Launch System missions that could run through the middle of the next decade.

title: CAS Space puts six satellites in orbit with first orbital launch
summary: Chinese launch services provider CAS Space successfully placed six small satellites in orbit early Wednesday with the first launch of the Lijian-1 solid rocket.

title: ESA selects Viasat for multi-orbit satellite communications study
summary: Viasat said July 26 it has been selected to study multi-orbit satellite networks for the European Space Agency.

title: Startup Wallaroo Labs wins Space Force contract to model performance of AI on edge devices
summary: Wallaroo Labs won a Phase 1 Small Business Innovation Research study contract from the U.S. Space Force to model the performance of machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms during space missions.

title: NASA Prepares for Space Launch System Rocket Services Contract
summary: As NASA prepares for the first integrated flight test of the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket and the Orion spacecraft to the Moon this summer as part of Artemis, the agency is moving toward a services contract model for long-term SLS hardware production and operations to reduce costs.

title: Massive Long March 5B booster predicted to reenter on July 31
summary: The first stage of the Long March 5B rocket which launched China’s Wentian space station module could reenter the atmosphere around July 31, according to a prediction from the Aerospace Corporation.

title: Russia says it will quit the International Space Station after 2024 and build its own
summary: As tensions continue to grow between Russia and the West over the ongoing war in Ukraine, Moscow has announced it will quit the International Space Station (ISS) after 2024.

title: Data from OSIRIS-REx reveals loose surface of asteroid Bennu and “early aging” of asteroids
summary: Recently analyzed data from an asteroid surface-sample collection performed by NASA’s OSIRIS-REx mission has revealed that asteroid 101955 Bennu’s surface regolith is much looser than previously thought. Had OSIRIS-REx not fired its thrusters to back away from Bennu after collecting its sample, the spacecraft likely would’ve sunk straight into Bennu’s surface.

title: NASA: no notification by Russia to end ISS participation
summary: NASA officials said July 26 they have received no official notification from Roscosmos of plans to end cooperation on the International Space Station despite comments from that agency’s new leader.

title: Sierra Space establishes national security advisory group
summary: Sierra Space has created a group of former government officials, including a retired vice chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff and a NASA deputy administrator, to advise the company as it seeks to win national security business.
